<denchmark-code>|| Chris Muktar on 2014-04-03 13:50 || Priority: Normal || Affected: branch 'master' (3.0-dev) || Category: build/install || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: || PR: || Platform: x86 / Mac OSX </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Python on Mac OSX Mavericks OpenCV 3.0-dev</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Hello,
I'm trying to get the edge version of Open CV 3 to run on Mac OSX 10.9. It compiles & installs OK, but when I try and import it using Python I get segmentation fault 11.
I'm using Python 2.7.5.
Any suggestions or ideas most welcome!
Thanks, Chris. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h5>Nikita Manovich on 2014-04-03 14:06</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Hi,
Thank you for your bug report. Could you please provide exact steps how to reproduce the problem? For example, your "cmake" command. Also we will be glad if you can provide more details about the crash. For example, information about stack is always important. If you can investigate the problem and fix it you will help us a lot.
For more information please see the links below: http://www.code.opencv.org/projects/opencv/wiki/Coding_Style_Guide http://www.code.opencv.org/projects/opencv/wiki/How_to_contribute - Target version deleted (3.0) - Assignee changed from Roman Donchenko to Chris Muktar - Status changed from New to Incomplete </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Chris Muktar on 2014-04-04 16:56</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>I didn't write it down, but I think it was the straightforward:
cmake -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -D CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr/local ..
Exact steps to reproduce were: * brew uninstall opencv (get rid of cv2) * git pull opencv/master * mkdir/cd release * cmake .. * make -j8 * sudo make install * python * import cv or import cv2
Result: Segmentation fault: 11
No errors on compilation or installation. Python segfault on import. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Chris Muktar on 2014-04-06 07:36</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>- Status changed from Incomplete to Open </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-h:h5>Chris Muktar on 2014-04-22 08:21</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>I'm still trying to get to the bottom of this but have shifted to doing my work on Ubuntu where everything works perfect, but am keen to get it working. I will keep trying to investigate but if anyone can see anything in the crash report that gives a clear signal please let me know! </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Chris Muktar on 2014-05-01 11:39</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>I have fixed this.
The problem is this - cmake gets confused between the system Python and brewed Python. The solution was to use ccmake and manually link the libraries and headers. - % Done changed from 0 to 50 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Eduard Feicho on 2014-12-01 02:54</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Chris Muktar wrote: > Hello, > > I'm trying to get the edge version of Open CV 3 to run on Mac OSX 10.9. It compiles & installs OK, but when I try and import it using Python I get segmentation fault 11. > > I'm using Python 2.7.5. > > Any suggestions or ideas most welcome! > > Thanks, > Chris.
You can install the HEAD revision from brew directly:
$ brew install --HEAD opencv </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Boaz Stolk on 2015-07-16 22:46</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>What I did to resolve this issue was as described here (http://www.cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/module/FindPythonLibs.html) added this to cmake command: <pre> -DPYTHON_LIBRARY=/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.9/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/libpython2.7.dylib -DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.9/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/include/python2.7 </pre> </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: This should have been resolved by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/3866>#3866</denchmark-link> .
